revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-01 07:08:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix quota error in batch delete shares

We got quota -1 many times when we delete the
same share many times in the same time. Because
we didn't change share status to deleting before
we reserve -1 quotas, then we can reserve -1 quotas
many times for one share (currently, share status is
equal to available). So we record the wrong usage
quota(shares, gigabytes) value.

Now, we remove the quota reserve to the place that the
share status has been changed to deleting.

Closes-bug: 1707379
Change-Id: Idd0014d898d5468923625e62f9e649926dc04e24
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-08-09 07:39:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix quota error in batch delete shares

We record the wrong usage quota (shares, gigabytes) value
when we delete one share many times at the same time.
Because we reserve -1 shares quota before we delete the
share record in db, then we can continue to get share info
from db and reserve quota -1 many times.

Changed to remove the quota reserve to the place that after
the share record has been deleted in db.

Closes-bug: 1707379

commit_message:
Fix quota error in batch delete shares

We record the wrong usage quota (shares, gigabytes) value
when we delete one share many times at the same time.
Because we reserve -1 shares quota before we delete the
share record in db, then we can continue to get share info
from db and reserve quota -1 many times.

Changed to remove the quota reserve to the place that after
the share record has been deleted in db.

Closes-bug: 1707379
Change-Id: Idd0014d898d5468923625e62f9e649926dc04e24

commit_message:
Implement testing using tempest

Rather than the previous basic functional tests, this
implements the use of tempest to exercise the API's
properly to validate that they're working properly.

Included is the normalisation of the way the upgrade
test is implemented to make it exactly in line with
the way the original API upgrade test was implemented
in the keystone repository. This keeps it consistent.

Change-Id: Id491d018beb30bce748240b50e9d66dcc1a249fa

commit_message:
Adds SR-IOV support

SR-IOV support has been added to Hyper-V since Windows / Hyper-V
Server 2012.

In order to properly use SR-IOV, the host must support it, and have it
enabled, and it must have SR-IOV capable NICs.

The Hyper-V vSwitches will have to be configured to enable SR-IOV.

vmutils: create_nic - mac_address can now be None. If None,
a dynamic address will be used instead.
hostuils: added get_nic_sriov_vfs - returns a list of dictionaries,
containing available vSwitch VFs.
networkutils: added set_vswitch_port_sriov - enables / disables SR-IOV
on the given switch port.

Implements: blueprint os-win-sriov

Change-Id: Ied27bb4e1b36e743b33c6b65351c2ee942ef535e

commit_message:
Reload nginx during syncs

Instead of stopping nginx during a sync of repository files, temporarily
disable the openstack-slushee site. This friendlier behavior will allow
for the repo server to share a web server with other sites and services.

Change-Id: I95cbd104d948f51cbff6a8396d1ba115ad99d7c6

subject: Allow deployment without glance-registry
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-18 12:20:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Allow deployment without glance-registry

The glance v1 API is deprecated and intended to be removed
from the glance code within the Queens or Rocky cycles.

When using the glance v2 API the glance-registry service is
optional, and the intention is to remove the glance-registry
service in the S cycle. The glance-registry service is required
when using the v1 API though.

Furthermore, when using the glance-registry service it is not
possible to execute a rolling upgrade without losing API
transactions.

Given the above information, this patch enables the deployment
of glance with only the v2 API enabled, and without the
glance-registry service. It adds a per-commit test to validate
that this configuration works.

commit_message:
Allow deployment without glance-registry

The glance v1 API is deprecated and intended to be removed
from the glance code within the Queens or Rocky cycles.

When using the glance v2 API the glance-registry service is
optional, and the intention is to remove the glance-registry
service in the S cycle. The glance-registry service is required
when using the v1 API though.

Furthermore, when using the glance-registry service it is not
possible to execute a rolling upgrade without losing API
transactions.

Given the above information, this patch enables the deployment
of glance with only the v2 API enabled, and without the
glance-registry service. It adds a per-commit test to validate
that this configuration works.

This patch also corrects a previous misconfiguration which
enabled the v2 registry service, but did not set the data_api
correctly for the API service to inform it that the registry
was operating.

The glance_enable_v1_registry variable is also removed as it
is meaningless. The v1 API *requires* the registry to be
enabled, so we just enable it if glance_enable_v1_api is
enabled.

Change-Id: Ie95daed286798d139f0a35ffdd2a4dd1cdda6ff9

subject: Disable glance-registry and the v1 API by default
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-18 17:47:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Disable glance-registry and the v1 API by default

When using the glance v2 API the glance-registry service is
optional, and the intention is to remove the glance-registry
service in the S cycle.

The glance v1 API is scheduled to be removed in Queens.
This patch therefore disables the v1 API by default to give
us as much time as possible to identify the impact of that
and to get the issues resolved before it is removed from
the code-base.

The patch also cleans up the glance-registry init files
to handle the transition in an existing environment.

Tests are added to validate that enabling the v1 API still
works, and enabling the v2 registry still works.

Change-Id: I4c27aa0ca5b649e4fa76cfd0f326d80f50074db1
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-11-18 18:20:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Disable glance-registry and the v1 API by default

When using the glance v2 API the glance-registry service is
optional, and the intention is to remove the glance-registry
service in the S cycle.

The glance v1 API is scheduled to be removed in Queens.
This patch therefore disables the v1 API by default to give
us as much time as possible to identify the impact of that

commit_message:
Disable glance-registry and the v1 API by default

When using the glance v2 API the glance-registry service is
optional, and the intention is to remove the glance-registry
service in the S cycle.

The glance v1 API is scheduled to be removed in Queens.
This patch therefore disables the v1 API by default to give
us as much time as possible to identify the impact of that
and to get the issues resolved before it is removed from
the code-base.

The patch also cleans up the glance-registry init files
to handle the transition in an existing environment.

Tests are added to validate that enabling the v1 API still
works, and enabling the v2 registry still works.

Change-Id: I4c27aa0ca5b649e4fa76cfd0f326d80f50074db1

subject: Adds metrics collection scenario
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-30 16:42:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "WIP: Adds metrics collection scenario

This test suite verifies that the instance metrics are properly published
and collected and have non-zero values. The verification is done via the
ceilometer API.

Waiting for the ceilometer compute agent to poll the resources is crucial,
otherwise the test suite will fail due to the fact that no samples would
be found published before checking the samples.

The ceilometer agent's polling interval should have the same value as
the test suite's polled_metric_delay. This can be done in two ways:
a. Configure tempest's polled_metric_delay, by adding the following
line in tempest.conf, in the telemetry section:
    polled_metric_delay = <desired value>
b. Set the interval value in pipeline.yaml on the compute node to the
desired value and restart the ceilometer compute agent.

The second method is preferred, as the interval value defined in
pipeline.yaml is 600 seconds, which would mean each test would last
at least 10 minutes.

Change-Id: I2ad696c221fba860a30621686b464b8486bea583

commit_message:
Adds metrics collection scenario

This test suite verifies that the instance metrics are properly published
and collected and have non-zero values. The verification is done via the
ceilometer API.

Waiting for the ceilometer compute agent to poll the resources is crucial,
otherwise the test suite will fail due to the fact that no samples would
be found published before checking the samples.

The ceilometer agent's polling interval should have the same value as
the test suite's polled_metric_delay. This can be done in two ways:
a. Configure tempest's polled_metric_delay, by adding the following
line in tempest.conf, in the telemetry section:
    polled_metric_delay = <desired value>
b. Set the interval value in pipeline.yaml on the compute node to the
desired value and restart the ceilometer compute agent.

The second method is preferred, as the interval value defined in
pipeline.yaml is 600 seconds, which would mean each test would last
at least 10 minutes.

Change-Id: I2ad696c221fba860a30621686b464b8486bea583

publish-to-pypi, as we begin to publish more services there.

commit_message:
Add external LB management handler hook interface

Based on conversation on an ansible issue[1], I implemented
a LB orchestration role[2] similar to the POC here[3].

This will allow external loadbalancer management roles to hook
into a universal notify listener "Manage LB" to perform before/
after endpoint management actions when the service is being
restarted.

[1]: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/27813
[2]: https://github.com/Logan2211/ansible-haproxy-endpoints
[3]: https://github.com/Logan2211/tmp-ansible-27813

Change-Id: I7d2f47e94826526e9a5a99d32575f691fb6b30fd

[{'created': '2017-03-28 08:39:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "VMware: serial console log (completed)

Commit ace11d3 adds a serial port device to instances, so the serial
console output can be sent to a virtual serial port concentrator (VSPC).
This patch finishes the implementation by returning the output saved by
VSPC to the end user. The config option 'serial_log_dir' should have the
same value as in the VSPC configuration (i.e. it must point to the same
directory).

The VSPC implementation is available at
https://github.com/openstack/vmware-vspc

blueprint vmware-console-log

commit_message:
VMware: serial console log (completed)

Commit ace11d3 adds a serial port device to instances, so the serial
console output can be sent to a virtual serial port concentrator (VSPC).
This patch finishes the implementation by returning the output saved by
VSPC to the end user. The config option 'serial_log_dir' should have the
same value as in the VSPC configuration (i.e. it must point to the same
directory).

The VSPC implementation is available at
https://github.com/openstack/vmware-vspc

blueprint vmware-console-log-complete

Change-Id: I7e40dc41b0354d414bc8eae331f8257959e1d123

transient failures.

to time. Implementing a retry should help to reduce
transient failures.

commit_message:
Added procedure to enable heat_policy.json.

After Heat relevant contents will split out from Horiozon,
I guess 'orchestration' key of POLICY_FILES settings will be
removed also.

So I've add procedure for adding this key
so that user can correctly enable heat_policy.json

Change-Id: I77ae6c6f63f5ae0f21e9aa6d33edca458bb17502

subject: Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-17 03:48:31.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/source/conf.py'], 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html

Change-Id: I980ad3f6468e0d8d984c27d367bd6546f78ee113
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html

Change-Id: I980ad3f6468e0d8d984c27d367bd6546f78ee113

commit_message:
Change scheduler extra_spec schema

In before, extra_spec is populated by scheduler hints. This patch
move scheduler hints under key 'hints'. This allows extra_spec
to accommodate other information in the future.

Change-Id: Ia7507e1ffec66436acb0639422082b8b555341e0

subject: Support batch delete containers with different states
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-20 06:12:08.000000000', 'files': ['zun/common/utils.py', 'zun/api/controllers/v1/containers.py'], 'message': "Support batch delete containers with different states

This patch expands the 'delete_after_stop' to support following status:
[consts.RUNNING, consts.CREATED, consts.ERROR, consts.STOPPED, consts.DELETED],
and calls container_stop when container status is running.

Change-Id: I2d5105964f8ad6c08c537bd59f48cb5f04fe3afb
Closes-Bug: #1733263
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Support batch delete containers with different states

This patch expands the 'delete_after_stop' to support following status:
[consts.RUNNING, consts.CREATED, consts.ERROR, consts.STOPPED, consts.DELETED],
and calls container_stop when container status is running.

Change-Id: I2d5105964f8ad6c08c537bd59f48cb5f04fe3afb
Closes-Bug: #1733263

commit_message:
Add swift_config puppet tag to the dockerized proxy service

This ensures that the base class is applied, setting the required hash
values in swift.conf properly when deploying a proxy node without the
storage service at the same time.

Closes-Bug: 1732663
Depends-On: I11c044bbc8b9f56f95ace9320cc77303d9a7543e
Change-Id: Id916413c9d74071968d9988b604664fad30282b2

commit_message:
ovsfw: Merge multiple conjunction flows

The ovsfw code generated multiple flows with the same or overlapping
match fields and different actions=conjunction(nnn,2/2) flows.
Merge such flows and generate only one flow with
actions=conjunction(mmm,2/2),conjunction(nnn,2/2) so that filtering
are correctly performed.

Change-Id: I0cd325b02f35e103606595b8b124010fff8dc397
Partial-bug: #1708092

commit_message:
Move install tasks into pre_tasks

Several install-time tasks are in the post install
tasks, mixed in with the config tasks.

This patch moves them to the pre_install task set
to make a clean break between pre/install/post
tasks and tidies up the tasks a little.

Change-Id: I12bceda01e747bc1c41925a7d4afeca8f7ce9d8e

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-21 07:35:19.000000000', 'files': ['handlers/main.yml'], 'message': 'Implement consistent restart handlers

Retries and daemon reloads are added to all the handlers
and the ordering of each task is set out according to
the same pattern as they keystone role.

Change-Id: Icc250e811fb89024f3f3c2f9520d1a6c9c21f0d3
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Implement consistent restart handlers

Retries and daemon reloads are added to all the handlers
and the ordering of each task is set out according to
the same pattern as they keystone role.

commit_message:
Remove unused variable and handlers

The variable repo_auto_rebuild appears to have been
introduced in kilo, but never used.

The 'Init reload' handler is no longer required as
all services are now managed via systemd and the
service module.

The 'reload ssh' handler is also unused.

Change-Id: I1078ff7d2bd1acd0d1cea90fb90bc632386f0daf

commit_message:
Include swift base class in the proxy class

This was missing, and therefore the Swif hashes were not properly set in
swift.conf if only the proxy manifest was applied (for example when
deploying separate storage nodes).

Related-Bug: 1732663
Change-Id: I11c044bbc8b9f56f95ace9320cc77303d9a7543e
(cherry picked from commit 86df82502853b351a333d7787899dca11e64783e)

subject: Correct the failed status in the baremetal workflow
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4978, 'name': 'Julie Pichon', 'email': 'jpichon@redhat.com', 'username': 'jpichon'}, {'_account_id': 7065, 'name': 'Brad P. Crochet', 'email': 'brad@redhat.com', 'username': 'bcrochet'}, {'_account_id': 8532, 'name': 'Ryan Brady', 'email': 'rbrady@redhat.com', 'username': 'rbrady'}, {'_account_id': 9712, 'name': 'Dougal Matthews', 'email': 'dougal.matthews@canonical.com', 'username': 'dougal'}, {'_account_id': 10112, 'name': 'Jason E. Rist', 'email': 'jrist@redhat.com', 'username': 'jrist'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-20 11:35:06.000000000', 'files': ['workbooks/baremetal.yaml'], 'message': 'Correct the failed status in the baremetal workflow

Two tasks in the introspect workflow have incorrectly been sending
"ERROR" statuses when they should have sent "FAILED". This then meant
the workflow appeared to finish without errors (or failures). This is
primarily a problem for the introspect_manageable_nodes workflow which
then can't detect errors and reports that everything was successful.

Change-Id: I34a91dd14bb19775ad62271def6ecb66398c84db
Closes-Bug: #1733303
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Correct the failed status in the baremetal workflow

Two tasks in the introspect workflow have incorrectly been sending
"ERROR" statuses when they should have sent "FAILED". This then meant
the workflow appeared to finish without errors (or failures). This is
primarily a problem for the introspect_manageable_nodes workflow which
then can't detect errors and reports that everything was successful.

Change-Id: I34a91dd14bb19775ad62271def6ecb66398c84db
Closes-Bug: #1733303

commit_message:
Add resources svg to heat-dashboard

These files are used to show resources in stack topology tab,
 and previously located in
 `openstack_dashboard/static/dashboard/img`.

Change-Id: Iefe65a3ca45d7521819e4bc9b12654583072402e

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-04-18 14:22:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Check failed cluster vm live migrations

At the moment, when migrating clustered instances, we only catch
HyperVVMNotFoundException exceptions, in which case we attempt to
recover the instance. For any other exception, the instance will
hang in a 'migrating' state.

This change checks the instance state, trying to recover if it's

commit_message:
Check failed cluster vm live migrations

At the moment, when migrating clustered instances, we only catch
HyperVVMNotFoundException exceptions, in which case we attempt to
recover the instance. For any other exception, the instance will
hang in a 'migrating' state.

This change checks the instance state, trying to recover if it's
not in an inconsistent state, setting it to 'error' state otherwise.

Depends-On: I6c268355213718d4d66e0e77a89c558cde3213b6

Closes-Bug: #1674438

Change-Id: I952122bc2f0386f68c0ad62d195cfc5d84648876
(cherry picked from commit 96c21a6686bfb8534321b432640c4f6dc3abe5fe)

subject: Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 19:52:25.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/source/conf.py'], 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I822799d34da3f4738c0e13538f8913401929a743
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I822799d34da3f4738c0e13538f8913401929a743

commit_message:
treats os-win exceptions

If a port dissapears while processing a port, some
os_win NotFound exceptions are raised. Catching them
and treating them will tidy up the logs.

NOTE(claudiub): hyperv_neutron_agent was refactored into the layer2 module
in master, resulting the conflict.

Conflicts:
        hyperv/neutron/agent/hyperv_neutron_agent.py
        hyperv/neutron/agent/layer2.py
        hyperv/tests/unit/neutron/agent/test_hyperv_neutron_agent.py
        hyperv/tests/unit/neutron/agent/test_layer2.py
        test-requirements.txt

Closes-Bug: #1684045

(cherry-picked from commit 1bd6e7047d30b79b1a808f97b904917c0d6ce146)
Change-Id: Id629251ca1addfac5c0c559085ff3d3d116c7b19

commit_message:
queues per manager rather than per pipeline

currently we create queue per pipeline which is not necessary. it
creates more memory usage and doesn't necessarily distribute
work more effectively. this hashes data to queues based on
manager but still internally, the data is destined to specific
pipeline based on event_type. this will minimise queue usage while
keeping internal code path the same.

Change-Id: I0ccd51f13457f208fe2ccedb6e680c91e132f78f

commit_message:
Add py35 jobs for refstack-client

Added py35 jobs at check and gate pipelines for refstack-client.
Even when refstack-client code should now support both py27 and py35. Jobs
are added initially as non-voting to give time for refactoring (if needed).

Change-Id: I7eeb56a69943908443276787e55669853264d06c

commit_message:
Change Subnet.dhcp_server to contain multiple IPs

Changed "dhcp_server" field in Subnet object from IPAddressField
to ListOfIPAddressField, because a subnet can have more than one
DHCP server.

The field is renamed to "dhcp_servers".

Currently, this field is not used in Nova [1], which is the only
project importing this library.

[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=dhcp_server&i=nope&files=&repos=nova

Close-Bug: #1720414

Change-Id: I44ed1b17dd30a8a38ecede0a4f82e7f8c1139bcf

Add 'fixed ips' APIs policy tests

'fixed ips' API tests are not covered for policy testing.
This commit adds The tests for this APIs.

commit_message:
Field network.multi_host is now deprecated.

This field is still in use in Nova. The value is set to "False" during
the initialization. The code related to this field should be removed
from this project.

Change-Id: I120e640f164028a09709b7beef7c2a190385ba42
Closes-Bug: #1719329

commit_message:
Fluent-logging helm chart

This introduces an initial helm chart for fluent logging.
It provides a functional fluent-bit and fluentd deployment to
use in conjunction with elasticsearch and kibana to consume
and aggregate logs from all resource types in a cluster.
It can deliver logs to kafka for external tools to consume.

This PS moved to osh repo
New PS: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/514622/

Specification: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/505491/
Partially implements: blueprint osh-logging-framework

Change-Id: Id23dc37e7b0eae84146e74477ca3e4f53648eb05

commit_message:
tox_install: Make this release script friendly

Make "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for $branch" automation work
by making tox_install.sh take a dummy "-c" argument to
match the expectation of release scripts. [1]

[1] https://github.com/openstack-infra/project-config/blob/5c8fe5a65961aee6fdf292dabe81c71fa297f48d/jenkins/scripts/release-tools/functions#L88

Change-Id: I7ec80a001f6371b6c6be6ca742468a09f64fe30b

commit_message:
zuul: run TripleO jobs with new zuulv3 layout

Configure the layout to execute the scenario001 jobs.
Note that baremetal job will be run on stable/pike and container on
Queens and beyond.

A note has been added in comment explaining more details.

Change-Id: Ibbe35a84a4de14f02d4db0d9d5c7a9b5d01ec8d0

commit_message:
Remove congress_dashboard from congress repo

As new project is created for congress_dashboard
https://github.com/openstack/congress-dashboard, this commit removes the
ununsed folder in congress repo

Change-Id: I2a433608c3ccff9f6ede08ba4a9a6d181bafc1c0

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

commit_message:
Add TLS for ec2api metadata service

This adds a TLS proxy in front of it so it serves TLS in the
internal network.

bp tls-via-certmonger

commit_message:
config-download: use workflow supported in Queens

In Queens, tripleoclient will run a Mistral workflow to execute the
ansible tasks.
See I18815c9920454290d965ef632a29ee13c718cd0d and
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/514701/ for details.

This patch does:

- adding some notes in comments so we cleanup later

Note: a lot of this work will be cleaned up later as we're doing fast
iterations here.

Change-Id: If23e223b4a0387efcc745d02154c6bdd2dee23fc
Implements: ansible-config-download-ci

commit_message:
Remove neutron debug tool

Commit 1f4c82ce9ea0676c4e813cc34bdb8687f63452e3 marked the code as
deprecated. This is over 18 months ago and no one uses this.

This patch finally removes the code.

commit_message:
Support Token Session in Zaqar

Token Session: the basic idea is Zaqar
can support to verify the token with keytone once,
and keep this token valid for a while that means no
need to verity the token again.

This purpose is to enhance the Zaqar's performace,
reduce the time spent on keystone authorization.

Change-Id: I5a5a480a8cdfbb32d3d6267cb7dc441f3bf5a6f4
Implements: blueprint support-token-session-in-zaqar

commit_message:
Fix: magnum devstack installation with tls-proxy

Fix wrongly used start_tls_proxy function and correctly set api port
when tls-proxy is enabled.

Also remove start_tls_proxy for ec2 which is not required.

Co-Authored-By: yatin <ykarel@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I71b85b5cb018dd790e13aaa1eeefcbb8ac0b3b85
Closes-Bug: #1727613

commit_message:
Tolerate spaces in extra capability values

The intent behind limiting the split of the query string at all appears
to be supporting values with spaces, but it's off-by-one, limiting the
number of splits to 3 (4 parts max) rather than 3 parts max.

This commit also generates new random values for variables id and
computehost_id during each call to _get_fake_host_extra_capabilities()
rather than just once, which is necessary to avoid a failing test due to
duplicate id values.

Closes-Bug: #1732787
Change-Id: I8dc56aa983ca27763a63325810753148cb8d8ecd

commit_message:
Allow deleting leases which failed to start at any time

Leases which failed to start could not be deleted until their end date.
This patch enables deletion of such leases at any time.

Change-Id: I8a4764fdcf4750a0dd89e787ee96d930245e8cf7
Closes-Bug: #1713768
(cherry picked from commit 3c1143085fa38a4e31b06d3c798586caf47dc27c)

subject: Fix display of host details when cpu_info is empty
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-14 16:03:34.000000000', 'files': ['blazar_dashboard/api/client.py'], 'message': 'Fix display of host details when cpu_info is empty

If a Blazar host was created with an empty cpu_info value, displaying
host details would fail with the error:

    SyntaxError: unexpected EOF while parsing (<string>, line 0)

This is because calling eval() on an empty string raises a SyntaxError.
This patch ensures that if cpu_info is empty, it is set to an empty
dictionary instead.

Change-Id: I38d9f92fd7937de4ec1492d06ddea834b6c423ef
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix display of host details when cpu_info is empty

If a Blazar host was created with an empty cpu_info value, displaying
host details would fail with the error:

    SyntaxError: unexpected EOF while parsing (<string>, line 0)

This is because calling eval() on an empty string raises a SyntaxError.
This patch ensures that if cpu_info is empty, it is set to an empty
dictionary instead.

Change-Id: I38d9f92fd7937de4ec1492d06ddea834b6c423ef

commit_message:
Migrate to Zuul v3

Migrate all functional jobs and gate to zuul v3.
We will have to migrate all other legacy jobs too later.
This patch do step 1 in the docs: Move Legacy Jobs to Projects.

Co-Authored-By: Dai Dang Van <daidv@vn.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: Ie2f41fd211dad4852fadaa05fdda7536f18b38eb
Needed-By: I9fdfe396e6f84b632fae182dade30914865bd3bf
Needed-By: I8e093bd3bb880b6b2c11a20e785c5a562f66159c

always declare partitioning variables

also, just use partition_coordinator to figure out if we need to handle
stuff as that's what we use everywhere else.

commit_message:
Deploy Ceph Luminous and add support for CephMgr service

The upgrade of Ceph to Luminous requires a new daemon, ceph-mgr, to be
deployed with every ceph-mon. This submission adds support for the
deployment of ceph-mgr via ceph-ansible.

Change-Id: I4226233d02b70980c6b53518ae2d511b653ce2de
Depends-On: I3645c6c3f68fcefc93fa8699796ba8892aa946c8
Implements: blueprint ceph-luminous

commit_message:
Remove v1 api-ref documents

This commit removes v1 api-ref documents. Because it's very confusing
when people click the "Block Storage API V1 (LEGACY)" links on the
api-ref page[1]. It's just a link to the api-ref object-storage page[1].

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/index.html

Change-Id: Ibb19bc1b951298c3f95bca7d123d3b7c9dc6b91c

subject: use agent api def from neutron-lib
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-15 17:43:57.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/tests/unit/test_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron_lbaas/extensions/lbaas_agentschedulerv2.py'], 'message': "use agent api def from neutron-lib

The agent extension's API definition was moved into neutron-lib with
commit Iae4746aa2e3f68a7120696a12a6ae717115dbc31 and will be consumed
in neutron with I18aebec1e2b5b361d9b96192d4a59e5424c6a80b
This patch consumes it by:
- Switching over to lib's implementation for the agent extension.
- Removing the unit test setup that updates the global
RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP for the agent. This is done automatically so
is not needed.

Change-Id: Icd545a57835f7c3a79b82cfffd1b6a6ca017fb0b
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
use agent api def from neutron-lib

The agent extension's API definition was moved into neutron-lib with
commit Iae4746aa2e3f68a7120696a12a6ae717115dbc31 and will be consumed
in neutron with I18aebec1e2b5b361d9b96192d4a59e5424c6a80b
This patch consumes it by:
- Switching over to lib's implementation for the agent extension.
- Removing the unit test setup that updates the global
RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP for the agent. This is done automatically so
is not needed.

Change-Id: Icd545a57835f7c3a79b82cfffd1b6a6ca017fb0b

commit_message:
Add ansible and pyton-shade to the base image

Ansible and shade will be used to run some of the provisioning
operations as part of the kubernetes and ansible role based deployment
of the services. Having it in the base images makes it possible to use
any of the service images to run ansible commands, just like we do with
puppet.

Change-Id: I76efb92e27955b6e9054d4e7dcfda5ba1d8b2d2f

subject: Fix KeyError exception in ChanceScheduler.schedule
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-01 07:50:15.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/tests/unit/drivers/common/test_agent_driver_base.py', 'neutron_lbaas/agent_scheduler.py'], 'message': 'Fix KeyError exception in ChanceScheduler.schedule

The return value of function "get_agent_hosting_loadbalancer" is either
None or a dict. Most of the time, it looks good because it usually
returns None. But when multi neutron-server rescheduled the same
loadbalancer from a dead agent almost simultaneously, it might return a
dict, which would cause KeyError since the dict format is such like
{'agent': {'id': xxx, ...}}.

Change-Id: Iac0f99590146ef870a979a6b4ac28b69e9e186e4
Closes-Bug: #1668513
(cherry picked from commit ad7a78197665afc98a1ae4dc5bfabf2019e93241)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix KeyError exception in ChanceScheduler.schedule

The return value of function "get_agent_hosting_loadbalancer" is either
None or a dict. Most of the time, it looks good because it usually
returns None. But when multi neutron-server rescheduled the same
loadbalancer from a dead agent almost simultaneously, it might return a
dict, which would cause KeyError since the dict format is such like
{'agent': {'id': xxx, ...}}.

Change-Id: Iac0f99590146ef870a979a6b4ac28b69e9e186e4
Closes-Bug: #1668513
(cherry picked from commit ad7a78197665afc98a1ae4dc5bfabf2019e93241)

The TaskFlow flow loader was not honoring the TaskFlow engine configured in
the octavia.conf. This patch corrects that behavior so the "parallel" engine
can be used.

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-11-10 00:57:14.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/common/base_taskflow.py', 'octavia/tests/unit/common/test_base_taskflow.py'], 'message': 'Fix TaskFlow loader to honor engine configuration

commit_message:
Fix TaskFlow loader to honor engine configuration

The TaskFlow flow loader was not honoring the TaskFlow engine configured in
the octavia.conf. This patch corrects that behavior so the "parallel" engine
can be used.

Change-Id: I4e9a21f1c58cbf65f4247fe3e2255dc614080bc7

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-16 20:54:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Include project_id and user_id in AllocationList.get_all_by_consumer_id

To support including project_id and user_id in the output of GET
/allocations/{consumer_uuid} adjust the
_get_allocations_by_consumer_uuid query to join the necessary tables to
get project_id and user_id information.

Note that this is done as outer joins because in order to support older
(but not much older) microversions we need to allow those fields to be
null.

_get_allocations_by_provider_id is not extended in the same way as we
do not yet have any immediate need for the information in GET
/resource_providers/{uuid}/allocations.

Change-Id: I59175fa51e9553f41c73a6bcd1a77a134e0b19e3
Partially-Implements: bp symmetric-allocations

commit_message:
Include project_id and user_id in AllocationList.get_all_by_consumer_id

To support including project_id and user_id in the output of GET
/allocations/{consumer_uuid} adjust the
_get_allocations_by_consumer_uuid query to join the necessary tables to
get project_id and user_id information.

Note that this is done as outer joins because in order to support older
(but not much older) microversions we need to allow those fields to be
null.

_get_allocations_by_provider_id is not extended in the same way as we
do not yet have any immediate need for the information in GET
/resource_providers/{uuid}/allocations.

Change-Id: I59175fa51e9553f41c73a6bcd1a77a134e0b19e3
Partially-Implements: bp symmetric-allocations

subject: Fix tempest scenario tests waiters
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6579, 'name': 'Nir Magnezi', 'email': 'nmagnezi@redhat.com', 'username': 'nmagnezi'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys'}, {'_account_id': 10273, 'name': 'Adam Harwell', 'email': 'flux.adam@gmail.com', 'username': 'rm_you'}, {'_account_id': 10850, 'name': 'German Eichberger', 'email': 'german.eichberger@gmail.com', 'username': 'german'}, {'_account_id': 11628, 'name': 'Michael Johnson', 'email': 'johnsomor@gmail.com', 'username': 'johnsom'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-12 12:07:24.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/tests/tempest/v2/scenario/test_listener_basic.py', 'neutron_lbaas/tests/tempest/v2/scenario/base.py'], 'message': "Fix tempest scenario tests waiters

Cleanups for resources such as listeners, pools and health monitors are
currently using a waiter named _wait_for_load_balancer_status to get an
indication that the cleanup process ended successfully.

Because of the way that waiter is currently used in those cleanups,
it's basically just checking that the load balancer state is:
provisioning_status='ACTIVE'
operating_status='ONLINE'

This is not a good measure for the success of a cleanup for the
aforementioned resources since the deletion process of those simply has
no effect on either loadbalancer provisioning_status or
operating_status. Thus, this is not a good indicator.

This creates issues on high load test deployments.
For example: test_listener_basic is a scenario that deletes a listener
and verifies the absence of the load balancing functionality via
_check_load_balancing_after_deleting_resources.
In case the listener deletion is still undergoing (and currently it
does not have a good indication for that), the load balancer will
accept the traffic and fail the test.

The suggestion solution here is not to use _wait_for_load_balancer_status
as an indicator, but rather add waiters to check specifically if a given
resource got deleted or not.

Change-Id: Ib2e4c60e2db28f1345665c2f5859e8f5fde75bc0
(cherry picked from commit e7f14a6a5ca2472960d7a015b97b4cab580d3f53)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix tempest scenario tests waiters

Cleanups for resources such as listeners, pools and health monitors are
currently using a waiter named _wait_for_load_balancer_status to get an
indication that the cleanup process ended successfully.

Because of the way that waiter is currently used in those cleanups,
it's basically just checking that the load balancer state is:
provisioning_status='ACTIVE'
operating_status='ONLINE'

This is not a good measure for the success of a cleanup for the
aforementioned resources since the deletion process of those simply has
no effect on either loadbalancer provisioning_status or
operating_status. Thus, this is not a good indicator.

This creates issues on high load test deployments.
For example: test_listener_basic is a scenario that deletes a listener
and verifies the absence of the load balancing functionality via
_check_load_balancing_after_deleting_resources.
In case the listener deletion is still undergoing (and currently it
does not have a good indication for that), the load balancer will
accept the traffic and fail the test.

The suggestion solution here is not to use _wait_for_load_balancer_status
as an indicator, but rather add waiters to check specifically if a given
resource got deleted or not.

Change-Id: Ib2e4c60e2db28f1345665c2f5859e8f5fde75bc0
(cherry picked from commit e7f14a6a5ca2472960d7a015b97b4cab580d3f53)

commit_message:
Enable python hash randomization for tests

This should be enabled for all tests to ensure we don't introduce
bugs related to code relying on ordering of unordered types.

Change-Id: I11bcac3c1a5b6999bd82c2c430880cdfb2026593

commit_message:
Remove TLS-specific docker environment

This environment was made for testing, and was only meant to exist while
TLS everywhere got service parity. This is now the case (and has been
since pike was released) so we can safely remove this file.

Change-Id: Ib97cab101ee727ae8d784ecb7847dabdbac3ff17

commit_message:
pluggable notification agent

event, meter (and any other custom pipeline) can be enabled/disabled
by setting `pipelines` option under [notification] agent

Change-Id: Ia21256d0308457d077836e27b45d2acb8bb697e4
Closes-Bug: #1720021

v0.14. So need update the rewite syntax.

commit_message:
Add option for HAProxy (non-HA) container to log to stdout/stderr

This adds the option to get the HAProxy container to log to stdout.
The option is disabled by default. If enabled, It also adds a sidecar
container that reads from syslog and outputs what it gets to stdout.

bp logging-stdout-rsyslog

Change-Id: Ica819713aa50352ba04a748c463534d982e00538

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-13 14:07:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add rsyslog-sidecar resource and configuration

This introduces a "sidecar" container, which is meant to be used
besides other containers (or as part of the pod). It merely uses
rsyslog to listen on a specific UNIX socket and outputs what it
gets to stdout.

This adds the service to each relevant role and introduces a
composable service which merely configures the container. Subsequently
it'll be used as part of other templates.

Note that it is only enabled if "stdout logging" is enabled.

bp logging-stdout-rsyslog
Depends-On: I4864ddca223becd0a17f902729cf2e566df5e521

commit_message:
Add rsyslog-sidecar resource and configuration

This introduces a "sidecar" container, which is meant to be used
besides other containers (or as part of the pod). It merely uses
rsyslog to listen on a specific UNIX socket and outputs what it
gets to stdout.

This adds the service to each relevant role and introduces a
composable service which merely configures the container. Subsequently
it'll be used as part of other templates.

Note that it is only enabled if "stdout logging" is enabled.

bp logging-stdout-rsyslog
Depends-On: I4864ddca223becd0a17f902729cf2e566df5e521

Change-Id: I2c54acaaa820961c936f1fbe304f42162f720496

commit_message:
Fix the undercloud-containers job

The undercloud installer (when using --heat-native) can configure
its own docker settings.

Also, use yum install to add required packages until we can get these
installed via RDO.

Ensure the /etc/hosts file is cleaned out for the undercloud deployment

Co-Authored-By: Wes Hayutin <weshayutin@gmail.com>

Depends-On: I2d569eef136254dc81bdee93a7869fd361a8400d
Change-Id: I583128ef8fb986a08ea372344ed072e506b97d89

commit_message:
Set file mode permission for Ceph keyrings in containers

Pass mode parameter to ceph-ansible for Ceph keyrings on container
host. Pass mode and ownership parameter to each Ceph client container
using kolla_config. ACLs are set for Cinder if it is not running in
containers.

Change-Id: I11618b3fd696739ad9b86618a1f3f96570c61a30
Partial-Bug: #1720787

subject: Prevent pyroute2.IPDB threads leaking
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6598, 'name': 'Berezovsky Irena', 'email': 'irenab.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'irenab'}, {'_account_id': 11600, 'name': 'Michał Dulko', 'email': 'mdulko@redhat.com', 'username': 'dulek'}, {'_account_id': 14352, 'name': 'Antoni Segura Puimedon', 'email': 'celebdor@gmail.com', 'username': 'toni'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23567, 'name': 'Luis Tomas Bolivar', 'email': 'ltomasbo@redhat.com', 'username': 'ltomasbo'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-02 18:44:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Prevent pyroute2.IPDB threads leaking

pyroute2.IPDB is an interesting entity. It's much more than a simple
interface to `ip` command, as it is more similar to a database process.
When created IPDB object spawns a thread that will be responsible for
updating the object with changes to the underlying OS. Thread stays up
until the user will call `release()` method.

Turns out code in kuryr_kubernetes.cni.binding wasn't taking that into
account and was slowly leaking threads (and possibly processes). This
became apparent when running Kuryr with CNI daemon enabled.

This commit fixes the problem by switching all IPDB usages to context
managers, so `release()` method is called automatically.  Also the IPDB
objects cache is removed as already released IPDB objects cannot be
reused.

Change-Id: I82afda3f217dac56228677bb66703c3d80e5d751
Closes-Bug: 1728996
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-11-03 10:06:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Prevent pyroute2.IPDB threads leaking

commit_message:
Prevent pyroute2.IPDB threads leaking

pyroute2.IPDB is an interesting entity. It's much more than a simple
interface to `ip` command, as it is more similar to a database process.
When created IPDB object spawns a thread that will be responsible for
updating the object with changes to the underlying OS. Thread stays up
until the user will call `release()` method.

Turns out code in kuryr_kubernetes.cni.binding wasn't taking that into
account and was slowly leaking threads (and possibly processes). This
became apparent when running Kuryr with CNI daemon enabled.

This commit fixes the problem by switching all IPDB usages to context
managers, so `release()` method is called automatically.  Also the IPDB
objects cache is removed as already released IPDB objects cannot be
reused. kuryr_kubernetes.cni.binding modules were missing unit tests,
this commit adds them as well.

Change-Id: I82afda3f217dac56228677bb66703c3d80e5d751
Closes-Bug: 1728996

commit_message:
Fixed generated temp file problem for RBD backend

Generated file doesn't have EOF char and it is problematic to read
by rados libraries.
New line char fix the problem.

Closes-bug: #1684077

commit_message:
Set host name explicitly for telemetry

Without this there could be a mismatch with other services like
nova and neutron and ceilometer wont find nova instances.

required for some time, now that we can set the Pod DNS policy
to "ClusterFirstWithHostNet".

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 14:29:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Remove ansible functional tests for now

These aren't actually testing openstacksdk in any way at the moment,
and having them is making us have a test-requirements depend on shade
which will make adding openstacksdk as a shade requirement a circular
dependency.

Remove them for now. To re-add them, we want to:

- add openstacksdk as a shade requirement
- update ansible to import openstack instead of import shade

Once that's done, we can add the tests back, but without adding shade as
an sdk test-requirement. That way we can have shade test that the
ansible modules work if someone installs shade and doesn't explicitly
install sdk, and we can have sdk test that the modules work if someone
installs sdk and not shade.

commit_message:
Remove ansible functional tests for now

These aren't actually testing openstacksdk in any way at the moment,
and having them is making us have a test-requirements depend on shade
which will make adding openstacksdk as a shade requirement a circular
dependency.

Remove them for now. To re-add them, we want to:

- add openstacksdk as a shade requirement
- update ansible to import openstack instead of import shade

Once that's done, we can add the tests back, but without adding shade as
an sdk test-requirement. That way we can have shade test that the
ansible modules work if someone installs shade and doesn't explicitly
install sdk, and we can have sdk test that the modules work if someone
installs sdk and not shade.

Change-Id: Icb26f9c066bad6c2c045ac949ac1864e26b5b837

subject: Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-17 10:07:50.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/source/conf.py'], 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html

Change-Id: Id0925ef2efce76024dbf1d519e92be3fdcff940b
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html

Change-Id: Id0925ef2efce76024dbf1d519e92be3fdcff940b

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-20 23:28:55.000000000', 'files': ['roles/submit-logstash-jobs/defaults/main.yaml'], 'message': "Stop indexing libvirt logs

The libvirt log files can be quite large depending on the job run (into
the million line range). This means they take significant amounts of
time to index which backs up all the indexing. Lets remove these files
for now (mriedem, nova ptl, has said this won't be a great loss for
them) and if someone needs them indexed again they can help sort out how
to do it more quickly.

Change-Id: I6b567eaf8a59634bc2486423bd87553605bb9657
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Stop indexing libvirt logs

The libvirt log files can be quite large depending on the job run (into
the million line range). This means they take significant amounts of
time to index which backs up all the indexing. Lets remove these files
for now (mriedem, nova ptl, has said this won't be a great loss for
them) and if someone needs them indexed again they can help sort out how
to do it more quickly.

Change-Id: I6b567eaf8a59634bc2486423bd87553605bb9657

commit_message:
KubeADM: Move shell commands to use bash and set env vars

This PS moves the shell module invocations to use bash and set the
required env vars explicity. This can seolve some issues on ubuntu
workstation hosts which uses dash for shell commands by default.

Change-Id: Ieb440e421d9d95676719d66fb4c787f88a9d8a2b

commit_message:
Use openstack commands for postci

Switch the nova and heat commands to the openstackclient equivalients.
Due to the way that the openstack commands run, it is more efficient to
pipe in a set of commands than run them individually.

Change-Id: I982b618fd39e3f148bfa4d6e784306fa01c4b30d

commit_message:
Include swift base class in the proxy class

This was missing, and therefore the Swif hashes were not properly set in
swift.conf if only the proxy manifest was applied (for example when
deploying separate storage nodes).

Related-Bug: 1732663
Change-Id: I11c044bbc8b9f56f95ace9320cc77303d9a7543e

commit_message:
Add support to generate a sample undercloud.conf

This is needed to kick off undercloud install with
--use-heat option. This includes new config options
to configure containerized undercloud along with
existing instack options.

Change-Id: Ibebaf068018a790afdb599e4e6fbc79d3b2a57dc
Partially-implements: blueprint heat-undercloud

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: I4bff5f12742364f7cc92e17869a047fd2185dda4

By default the upstream puppetlab module does not enable this option for
Red Hat based systems. Since some of the services we deploy are

Change-Id: I918e1e9bbdc35235a552555458a0f4118b70e988

commit_message:
Enable ntp iburst

By default the upstream puppetlab module does not enable this option for
Red Hat based systems. Since some of the services we deploy are
sensitive to clock skew, let's switch ibrust on to improve
syncronization.

Change-Id: I918e1e9bbdc35235a552555458a0f4118b70e988
Closes-Bug: #1731883
(cherry picked from commit 3f13662c8033b5af5e1c35107d9e37df96903eaa)
(cherry picked from commit 077fd545b03ebcd2ddf8f3b5a702926b2c6f26db)

investigation of DNS queries failures.

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Fix two releasenotes that used broken RST, `X' is invalid, use instead
``X``. The release notes build failed due to the broken RST.

Change-Id: I5f526f39bdc9bb76266b5a86a4b96854db21d0de

commit_message:
Temporarily make opensuse jobs non-voting

As we're getting failures for opensuse jobs due to broken
mirrors so we're forced to switch all opensuse tests to
non-voting until the infra mirrors are fixed.

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I8eca3dae9db90d7c592eb5bcebb2273a81d1a571

commit_message:
Use staging directory for prepare-docs-for-afs

Rather then doing out work inside the build/html folder, use a staging
folder. This will prevent our fetch-sphinx-output role from copying
the contents of build/html until we are actually ready for the docs to
publish.

This fixes an issue where feature branch docs should not be published,
but actually are because build/html always contains data.

Change-Id: I9fbd5c4cfa984ba7d693c46faf48751d2fbdf5f5
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Complete move of baremetal machine tests

Migrating tests to wrap up machine actions.

Ports will be migrated separately as there
will also need to be portgroups, which could
be wrapped into the same file/class depending
on how that ends up being implemented.

Change-Id: I239bbc134f42a47e8df75531dbd50916a97a6068

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

commit_message:
zuul: run TripleO jobs with new zuulv3 layout

Configure the layout to execute the scenario002 jobs.
Note that baremetal job will be run on stable/pike and container on
Queens and beyond.

A note has been added in comment explaining more details.

Change-Id: I36906ea111a4dc7b5ee3224ee439c6be56e6a710

[{'created': '2016-01-18 22:26:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fail deploy if agent returns >= 400

Currently the status code returned by IPA's POST /v1/commands API is
completely ignored by Ironic. This causes deploys to get stuck, as
future heartbeats will see that the command has not yet been accepted
and will continue to wait.

If IPA returns an error code to Ironic's agent client, we should bubble
that exception up, causing a deploy failure higher in the chain.

This adds an AgentAPIError exception class, and raises it when the agent
returns a 400 status code or higher when issuing a command.

commit_message:
Fail deploy if agent returns >= 400

Currently the status code returned by IPA's POST /v1/commands API is
completely ignored by Ironic. This causes deploys to get stuck, as
future heartbeats will see that the command has not yet been accepted
and will continue to wait.

If IPA returns an error code to Ironic's agent client, we should bubble
that exception up, causing a deploy failure higher in the chain.

This adds an AgentAPIError exception class, and raises it when the agent
returns a 400 status code or higher when issuing a command.

Co-Authored-By: Jay Faulkner <jay@jvf.cc>

Related-bug: 1542506
Change-Id: I07fb8115d254e877d8781207eaec203e3fdf8ad6

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-17 07:40:08.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/source/conf.py'], 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html

Change-Id: I2b9944d91ec6f4c1822591092d4551ee85f0de5e
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html

Change-Id: I2b9944d91ec6f4c1822591092d4551ee85f0de5e

commit_message:
Clean up bindep.txt file

With zuulv3, we are now using bindep.txt more to manage
build-wheel-jobs.  As such, give an update to start supporting
centos-7. I've also cleaned up a few depedencies we no longer need.

This also add support to test wheel-mirror builds.

Change-Id: Ia6c1113d119b01e7189e4ada41e10865c4ec0066
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I16981e37c2e641c05fa65d5151b3dadf1e951482

commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I5d7c550414c9bf0f7eaa6116d2a5502750777638

commit_message:
[placement] manage cache headers for allocations

In microversion 1.11 and cache-control and last-modified headers
when listing allocations, either via GET /allocations/{consumer_uuid}
or GET /resource_providers/{uuid}/allocations.

In either case, the last-modified time is the created_at time of the
most recently created Allocation in the allocations collection.
Allocations never have an updated_at time because they are only
inserted, never updated.

Change-Id: I9934f49fc9adab0abffcdb20182fc65986e4e8c7
Partial-Bug: #1632852
Partially-Implements: bp placement-cache-headers

[{'created': '2017-10-25 16:32:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[placement] manage cache headers for aggregates

As part of microversion 1.11, add cache-control and last-modified
headers to GET and PUT /resource_providers/{uuid}/aggregates.

In this case the time in the header is the current time.

While aggregates do have created_at and updated_at times, what matters
here is when the resource provider was made a member of the aggregate,
which is not something we expose anywhere. The time fields are present
on the ResourceProviderAggregate model (which joins resource providers
to aggregates) but neither set_aggregates nor get_aggregates on the
ResourceProvider OVO provides access to this info and adding it would be
more effort than it is worth. And finally, setting an aggregate
membership does not change the resource provider generation, so the
update_at time on the ResourceProvider is of no use in this case as
well.

Thus current time.

commit_message:
[placement] manage cache headers for aggregates

As part of microversion 1.11, add cache-control and last-modified
headers to GET and PUT /resource_providers/{uuid}/aggregates.

In this case the time in the header is the current time.

While aggregates do have created_at and updated_at times, what matters
here is when the resource provider was made a member of the aggregate,
which is not something we expose anywhere. The time fields are present
on the ResourceProviderAggregate model (which joins resource providers
to aggregates) but neither set_aggregates nor get_aggregates on the
ResourceProvider OVO provides access to this info and adding it would be
more effort than it is worth. And finally, setting an aggregate
membership does not change the resource provider generation, so the
update_at time on the ResourceProvider is of no use in this case as
well.

Thus current time.

Change-Id: I573deb680264564365aec3fa450250c4b00e476d
Partial-Bug: #1632852
Partially-Implements: bp placement-cache-headers

Since these resources are the result of a complex composition

commit_message:
[placement] manage cache headers for usages

Add last-modifed and cache-control headers to GET /usages and
/resource_providers/{uuid}/usages in a 1.11 microversion.

Since these resources are the result of a complex composition
that is expected to change frequently, the last-modified time
is set to utcnow. While it would be possible to calculate a
time based on the updated time of the most recent allocation
used to generate the usages, it doesn't seem worth it since
the question represented by the requests is "what is the usage
_now_"?

Change-Id: Ibf887ed72889e99fc8bfe15b6761f796b029e964
Partial-Bug: #1632852
Partially-Implements: bp placement-cache-headers

commit_message:
[placement] manage cache headers for resource classes

The details of which requests (and microversion) get a last-modified
and cache-control header are in resource-classes-last-modified.yaml.

Due the presence of the resource class cache, exposing the updated_at
and created_at fields which are already available in the database (as a
result of the TimestampMixin) required a fair amount of adjustment in
nova/objects/resource_provider.py and
nova/db/sqlalchemy/resource_class_cache.py. The overarching change is
adding the all_from_string method on the rc_cache which returns the full
details of a resource class from a new all_cache. There were other
option for doing this (expanding one of the existing caches, getting rid
of caching altogether). The method chosen felt like it had minimal
impact on other code.

Change-Id: Ic488c7204d9462f801da7c3e66cb6d00e01243be
Partial-Bug: #1632852
Partially-Implements: bp placement-cache-headers

commit_message:
[placement] manage cache headers for inventories

Add cache-control and last-modified headers to:

* GET /resource_providers/{uuid}/inventories
* GET /resource_provider/{uuid}/inventories/{class}
* PUT /resource_provier/{uuid}/inventories (which returns
  a body)

The existing updated_at and created_at columns are used as data
sources. In the case of PUT these fields have not been implemented
on the objects (because they have not been created) so the current
time is used instead (which makes sense).

The database query for getting inventory is adjusted to include the
updated_at and created_at columns.

Change-Id: If9e2bf494ee751a3f60a7b2f330e99b11b869d76
Partial-Bug: #1632852
Partially-Implements: bp placement-cache-headers

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-18 17:03:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP: [placement] manage cache headers

This is a small demonstration of the changes that would be needed to
have the placement service producing the cache-control and last-modified
headers that it should be if it wants to be exhibiting correct behavior.
According the HTTP 1.1 RFC headers last-modified headers SHOULD always
be sent and if we do send them, we need Cache-Control headers. Despite
what it says 'no-cache' means "check to see if the version you have is
still valid as far as the server is concerned". Since our server doesn't
currently valdate conditional requests and will always return an entity,
it ends up meaning "don't cache" (which is what we want).

The main steps are:

* Add the base.NovaTimestampObject mixin to the relevant object in
  nova/objects/resource_provider.py
* To both the get single entity and get collection handlers add
  response.cache_control = 'no-cache'
* For single entity add response.last_modified = obj.updated_at or
  obj.created_at
* For collection, use a new list_last_modified utility method.

In typical placement framework fashion this has been done in a very
explicit way, as it makes what the handler is doing very visible, even
though it results in a bit of boilerplate.

So far this only does GET /resource_providers and GET
/resource_providers/{uuid}. If we don't like the idea, not worth going
further.

More discussion on the os-dev list shortly.

Change-Id: Ied97539db31c764b8ec311abf977736dc748ef64
Partial-Bug: #1632852
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-08-21 17:21:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP: [placement] manage cache headers

This is a small demonstration of the changes that would be needed to
have the placement service producing the cache-control and last-modified
headers that it should be if it wants to be exhibiting correct behavior.
According the HTTP 1.1 RFC headers last-modified headers SHOULD always
be sent and if we do send them, we need Cache-Control headers. Despite
what it says 'no-cache' means "check to see if the version you have is
still valid as far as the server is concerned". Since our server doesn't
currently valdate conditional requests and will always return an entity,
it ends up meaning "don't cache" (which is what we want).

The main steps are:

* Add the base.NovaTimestampObject mixin to the relevant object in
  nova/objects/resource_provider.py
* To both the get single entity and get collection handlers add
  response.cache_control = 'no-cache'
* For single entity add response.last_modified = obj.updated_at or
  obj.created_at
* For collection, discover the max modified time when traversing the
  list of object to create the serialized JSON output.

In typical placement framework fashion this has been done in a very
explicit way, as it makes what the handler is doing very visible, even
though it results in a bit of boilerplate.

So far this only does GET /resource_providers and GET
/resource_providers/{uuid}. Other resources which have a direct
relationship to database tables can get the same treatment. For those
resources (such as /allocation_candidates) that are composed, we should
set last_modified time to now().

Because these changes add new headers (even though they don't do
anything) a new microversion, 1.11.

Change-Id: Ied97539db31c764b8ec311abf977736dc748ef64
Partial-Bug: #1632852

', 'number': 7}, {'created': '2017-10-10 17:14:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[placement] manage cache headers for /resource_providers

According the HTTP 1.1 RFC headers last-modified headers SHOULD always
be sent and should have a tie to the real last modified time. If we do
send them, we need Cache-Control headers to prevent inadvertent caching
of resources.

This change adds a microversion 1.11 which adds the headers to GET
/resource_providers and GET /resource_providers/{uuid}.

Despite what it says 'no-cache' means "check to see if the version you
have is still valid as far as the server is concerned". Since our server
doesn't currently valdate conditional requests and will always return an
entity, it ends up meaning "don't cache" (which is what we want).

The main steps are:

* map base.NovaTimestampObject to ovo.TimestampedObject
* Add the base.NovaTimestampObject mixin to the relevant object in
  nova/objects/resource_provider.py
* To both the get single entity and get collection handlers add
  response.cache_control = 'no-cache'
* For single entity add response.last_modified = obj.updated_at or
  obj.created_at
* For collection, discover the max modified time when traversing the
  list of object to create the serialized JSON output.

In typical placement framework fashion this has been done in a very
explicit way, as it makes what the handler is doing very visible, even
though it results in a bit of boilerplate.

Other resources which have a direct relationship to database tables
like resource providers, will get the same treatment in subsequent
patches. For those resources (such as /allocation_candidates) that
are composed, we should set last_modified time to now().

Because these changes add new headers (even though they don't do
anything) a new microversion, 1.11, is in added. Since presumably we
don't want to add a new microversion for each patch, we start it
here and assumpe the subsequent patches will use the same microversion.

The depends on is to a requirements change to bump
oslo.versionedobjects to 1.28.0 which has the TimestampedObject.

Partially-Implements: bp placement-cache-headers
Change-Id: Ied97539db31c764b8ec311abf977736dc748ef64
Depends-On: Ia94ce24627072eb91df2370b40e1680dd8eacde9
', 'number': 8}, {'created': '2017-10-16 13:13:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[placement] manage cache headers for /resource_providers

According the HTTP 1.1 RFC headers last-modified headers SHOULD always
be sent and should have a tie to the real last modified time. If we do
send them, we need Cache-Control headers to prevent inadvertent caching
of resources.

This change adds a microversion 1.11 which adds the headers to GET
/resource_providers and GET and PUT /resource_providers/{uuid}.

Despite what it says 'no-cache' means "check to see if the version you
have is still valid as far as the server is concerned". Since our server
doesn't currently valdate conditional requests and will always return an
entity, it ends up meaning "don't cache" (which is what we want).

The main steps are:

* map base.NovaTimestampObject to ovo.TimestampedObject
* Add the base.NovaTimestampObject mixin to the relevant object in
  nova/objects/resource_provider.py
* To both the get single entity and get collection handlers add
  response.cache_control = 'no-cache'
* For single entity add response.last_modified = obj.updated_at or
  obj.created_at
* For collection, discover the max modified time when traversing the
  list of object to create the serialized JSON output. This is assisted
  by a new util method: pick_last_modfied.
* For put use obj.created_at directly

In typical placement framework fashion this has been done in a very
explicit way, as it makes what the handler is doing very visible, even
though it results in a bit of boilerplate.

Other resources which have a direct relationship to database tables
like resource providers, will get the same treatment in subsequent
patches. For those resources (such as /allocation_candidates) that
are composed, we should set last_modified time to now().

Because these changes add new headers (even though they don't do
anything) a new microversion, 1.11, is added. Since presumably we
don't want to add a new microversion for each patch, we start it
here and assume the subsequent patches will use the same microversion.

Partial-Bug: #1632852
Partially-Implements: bp placement-cache-headers
Change-Id: Ied97539db31c764b8ec311abf977736dc748ef64

commit_message:
[placement] manage cache headers for /resource_providers

According the HTTP 1.1 RFC headers last-modified headers SHOULD always
be sent and should have a tie to the real last modified time. If we do
send them, we need Cache-Control headers to prevent inadvertent caching
of resources.

This change adds a microversion 1.11 which adds the headers to GET
/resource_providers and GET and PUT /resource_providers/{uuid}.

Despite what it says 'no-cache' means "check to see if the version you
have is still valid as far as the server is concerned". Since our server
doesn't currently validate conditional requests and will always return an
entity, it ends up meaning "don't cache" (which is what we want).

The main steps are:

* map base.NovaTimestampObject to ovo.TimestampedObject
* Add the base.NovaTimestampObject mixin to the relevant object in
  nova/objects/resource_provider.py
* To both the get single entity and get collection handlers add
  response.cache_control = 'no-cache'
* For single entity add response.last_modified = obj.updated_at or
  obj.created_at
* For collections, discover the max modified time when traversing the
  list of objects to create the serialized JSON output. This is assisted
  by a new util method: pick_last_modfied.
* For PUT use the current time

In typical placement framework fashion this has been done in a very
explicit way, as it makes what the handler is doing very visible, even
though it results in a bit of boilerplate.

Other resources which have a direct relationship to database tables will
get the same treatment in subsequent patches. For those resources (such
as /allocation_candidates) that are composed, we should set
last_modified time to the current time.

Because these changes add new headers (even though they don't do
anything) a new microversion, 1.11, is added. Since presumably we
don't want to add a new microversion for each patch, we start it
here and assume the subsequent patches will use the same microversion.
The final patch in the series will include the necessary release note
and version history update.

Partial-Bug: #1632852
Partially-Implements: bp placement-cache-headers
Change-Id: Ied97539db31c764b8ec311abf977736dc748ef64

revisions:

The deployed servers scenario expects necessary packages to be installed.

commit_message:
WIP scenario001-multinode-oooq-container host doesn't need ceph package

The deployed servers scenario expects necessary packages to be installed.
Ceph packages are installed to run ceph commands on the container host.
As per a proposed ceph-ansible change [1] they don't need to be so this
frees up a requirement.

[1] https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/pull/1865

Change-Id: I59a43bc87b5a04b6617441b948f754f375bc3854

commit_message:
WIP: ceph-ansible invocation w/ ANSIBLE_STDOUT_CALLBACK=debug

Add new environment variable to ceph-ansible execution with
ANSIBLE_STDOUT_CALLBACK=debug so that in /var/log/mistral/
ceph-install-workflow.log will contain logs in a different
format.

Change-Id: Iad2433f73053fd4e02517601d79479fa00e43597

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-06 10:25:13.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/tripleo-packages.yaml'], 'message': 'Add condition to os-net-config run during upgrade.

This add two conditionals:
 - first check that os-net-config needs upgrade
 - second verify that the configuration file exist and non empty.

This prevent unnecessary run of os-net-config and error in certain
network configuration.

Change-Id: Ic905f7ed7e7fc9018bc494f77811392045fddfe8
Closes-Bug: #1730328
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add condition to os-net-config run during upgrade.

This add two conditionals:
 - first check that os-net-config needs upgrade
 - second verify that the configuration file exist and non empty.

This prevent unnecessary run of os-net-config and error in certain
network configuration.

Change-Id: Ic905f7ed7e7fc9018bc494f77811392045fddfe8
Closes-Bug: #1730328

commit_message:

As we're getting failures for opensuse jobs due to broken
mirrors so we're forced to switch all opensuse tests to
non-voting until the infra mirrors are fixed.

[{'created': '2017-05-24 19:32:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'DNM rework keystone auth for glance

a pile of changes to test. Will be split into more patches.

Change-Id: I6a93b71ac097e951dfc93fd1ee4d7ef483514f2c
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2017-05-25 15:49:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'DNM rework keystone auth for glance

a pile of changes to test. Will be split into more patches.

Change-Id: I6a93b71ac097e951dfc93fd1ee4d7ef483514f2c
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2017-06-06 16:22:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Rework keystone auth for glance

this patch changes the way glance client is instantiated, using
keystoneauth sessions and adapters.

In order to support glance API endpoint discovery from keystone catalig
and more unified way of client loading,
many options in [glance] config sections are deprecated, mostly those
that specified a (set of) glance API endpoint(s), some piece-wise.
Instead, a single option [glance]endpoint_override must be used when
required to access a specific (possibly load-balanced) glance API endpoint
without discovering it from keystone catalog.

Another set of deprecated options are those that are duplicating
keystoneauth session options in [glance] section.

Also, support for specifying a glance image reference using `glance://`
url scheme (possibly including glance API location) is deprecated.
After deprecation period, only UUID of a glance image will be supported as
glance image reference, and having UUID as image source will
automatically presume glance image.

As a side-effect of this patch, when configured properly, ironic should now
support glance API deployed under Apache vhost (with more complex URI
and no port).

Change-Id: I6a93b71ac097e951dfc93fd1ee4d7ef483514f2c
', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2017-06-06 17:11:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Rework keystone auth for glance
